qas.question: Which two nations has The Sun been very antagonistic towards?
What names were used by The Sun to characterize the French and Germans?
What is the paper's stance on the EU?
How was French president Jacques Chirac described by The Sun?
Which German chancellor was criticized by The Sun?

context: The Sun has been openly antagonistic towards other European nations, particularly the <a0_0>French and Germans<a0_0/>. During the 1980s and 1990s, the nationalities were routinely described in copy and headlines as <a1_0>"frogs", "krauts" or "hun"<a1_0/>. As the paper is <a2_0>opposed<a2_0/> to the EU it has referred to foreign leaders who it deemed hostile to the UK in unflattering terms. Former President Jacques Chirac of France, for instance, was branded "<a3_0>le Worm<a3_0/>". An unflattering picture of German chancellor <a4_0>Angela Merkel<a4_0/>, taken from the rear, bore the headline "I'm Big in the Bumdestag" (17 April 2006).
